verses.text: 但那受過困苦的，必不再見幽暗。以前 神使西布倫和拿弗他利地被輕視，日後卻要使它們在沿海之路、約旦河外和外族人的加利利，得著榮耀。

words.note: The elevated space indicates reverence for God.
Commonly translated as 'Gentiles' in biblical context.
Refers to the traditional Hebrew text of the Bible.

verses.text: 行在黑暗中的人民，看見了大光；住在死蔭之地的人，有光照耀他們。

words.definition: land of the shadow of death
words.note: A specific biblical phrase, often from Psalm 23.

verses.text: 你使這國之民增多，又加添他們的歡樂；他們在你面前歡樂，好像收割時的歡樂一樣；又像人在均分戰利品時的快樂一般。
因為他們所負的軛和肩頭上的杖，以及欺壓他們的人的棍，你都折斷了，像在米甸的日子一樣。

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon or describes an object.

verses.text: 因為戰士在戰爭喧嚷中所穿的靴，和輥在血中的袍，都必燒毀，成了燒火的燃料。

words.note: Here implies 'rolled in' or 'stained with'.

verses.text: 因為有一個嬰孩為我們而生，有一個兒子賜給我們；政權必擔在他的肩頭上；他的名必稱為「奇妙的策士、全能的 神、永恆的父、和平的君」。

words.definition: to be upon, to bear on

words.note: Often preceded by an elevated space in Chinese Bibles to denote reverence.
Here refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 他的政權與平安必無窮無盡地增加，他在大衛的寶座上治理他的國，以公平和公義使國堅立穩固，從現在直到永遠。萬軍之耶和華的熱心必成全這事。

words.note: A title for God meaning 'Lord of heavenly armies'.

verses.text: 主發出一個信息攻擊雅各家，信息落在以色列家。

words.note: Here likely a repetition/re-emphasis of 'Lord' from Jehovah.

verses.heading: God’s Judgment Intensifies

verses.text: 所有的人民，就是以法蓮和撒瑪利亞的居民，都要知道這事；他們憑著驕傲和自大的心說：

words.note: Also the name of a tribe or region.

verses.text: 「磚牆倒塌了，我們就用鑿好的石頭來建築；桑樹砍倒了，我們就用香柏樹替換。」
因此，耶和華必興起利汛的敵人來攻擊以色列，並且要激動以色列的仇敵。

words.note: Indicates purpose or result

verses.text: 東有亞蘭人，西有非利士人；他們張開口來要吞滅以色列。雖然這樣，耶和華的怒氣還沒有轉消，他的手仍然伸出。

words.note: Indicates purpose or result
Often used in context of anger subsiding

verses.text: 這人民還沒有回轉、歸向那擊打他們的萬軍之耶和華，也沒有尋求他。

words.note: Biblical term for repentance
Forms an adjectival phrase

verses.text: 因此，耶和華在一日之間，必從以色列中剪除頭和尾、棕枝與蘆葦。

words.note: Connects 'one day' with 'interval'

verses.text: 長老和尊貴人就是頭；用謊言教導人的先知就是尾。

words.note: Forms an adjectival phrase

verses.text: 因為那些領導這人民的，使他們走錯了路；那些被領導的，都必一片混亂。

words.definition: a scene of, a stretch of
words.note: Used to describe a general scene or area.

verses.text: 因此，主不喜歡他們的年輕人，也不憐恤他們的孤兒寡婦；因為他們各人都是不敬虔的，是邪惡的，各人的口都說愚昧的話。雖然這樣，耶和華的怒氣還沒有轉消，他的手仍然伸出。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in a religious context.
Often found in religious or classical texts.
A common pairing in biblical texts referring to vulnerable groups.
Lit. 'not reverent and pious'.
Often used in moral or religious contexts.
Often implies a lack of wisdom or understanding.
The Hebrew personal name for God.
Refers to a state of being angry.
Often used for emotions or conditions subsiding.

verses.text: 邪惡像火一般焚燒，吞滅荊棘蒺藜，連樹林中的密叢也燒起火來，它們旋轉上騰，成了煙柱。

words.note: Often used in moral or religious contexts.
Indicates similarity or commonality.
More formal or literary than just '燒' (shāo).
Often used hyperbolically or in solemn contexts.
A classical idiom for weeds and difficulties, common in Bible.
Describes fire starting and intensifying.
More poetic or formal than just '上升' (shàngshēng).

verses.text: 因著萬軍之耶和華的烈怒，地被燒毀，人民成了燒火的燃料一般，沒有人顧惜自己的兄弟。

words.note: Similar to '因為' but often implies a direct result.
A title for God emphasizing his power and heavenly army.
Describes intense and powerful anger.
Here, it describes the act of burning, often for fuel.
Indicates similarity or commonality.
Often used in contexts of showing mercy or compassion.

verses.text: 有人在右邊切肉，仍然飢餓；在左邊吞吃，仍然不飽足；各人竟吃自己手臂的肉。

words.note: Verb-object compound acting as a single action.
Can refer to the state of being hungry or hunger itself.
Implies eating quickly or greedily.
More formal than just '飽' (bǎo) for expressing satisfaction.
Expresses surprise or an unexpected outcome.

verses.text: 瑪拿西吞吃以法蓮，以法蓮吞吃瑪拿西，又一起攻擊猶大。雖然這樣，耶和華的怒氣還沒有轉消，他的手仍然伸出。

words.note: Hebrew tetragrammaton YHWH transliteration.
Implies anger subsiding or being turned away.
